item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.title: A Turning Point for China?
item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: Kasich Ceding Indiana, Cruz 2 States as Joint 'Stop Trump' Bid Gets Serious
item.description:
Kasich Ceding Indiana, Cruz 2 States as Joint 'Stop Trump' Bid Gets Serious

The effort to prevent billionaire Donald Trump from becoming the Republican Party's nominee for U.S. president took a new step late Sunday as his two chief rivals openly detailed their plan to work against the front-runner in three states.

item.title: Long-Classified Pages on Foreign 9/11 Support Could be Released Soon
item.description:
Long-Classified Pages on Foreign 9/11 Support Could be Released Soon

Only a select group of U.S. officials have read the highly classified document. The text has been locked in a secure area of the U.S. Capitol building since a joint congressional committee crafted it in 2002. Bills in both the Senate and House of Representatives and people who helped write it are calling for its release.

item.title: Report: Six African Nations Could be Malaria-free by 2020
item.description:
Report: Six African Nations Could be Malaria-free by 2020

Within the next four years, six nations in Africa - the region where malaria is most prominent - could be free of the disease, the World Health Organization said in a report published Monday to mark World Malaria Day.

item.title: US to Dial Back Peace Efforts in South Sudan
item.description:
US to Dial Back Peace Efforts in South Sudan

The United States is set to take a back seat in peace negotiations between the government of South Sudan and rebel leaders following failures on both sides to fulfill an agreement to form a transitional government.

item.title: Afghan Leader Demands Removal of Taliban from Pakistan
item.description:
Afghan Leader Demands Removal of Taliban from Pakistan

Afghan President Ashraf Ghani has demanded neighboring Pakistan evict fugitive Taliban leaders from its soil and hand them over to Kabul for trial. In a hard-hitting speech to a rare joint session of parliament Monday, Ghani said Pakistani leaders promised they would use force against Taliban leaders who refuse to end the war and join Afghan peace talks.
